```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)
```

```{r}
df = read_csv("ap_exam_scores_mean_3.11.csv") |> clean_names()
```

# Take a random sample of 10 students from a population that has a mean of 3.11

```{r}
# sample 10
sample_of_10 = df |> sample_n(10)
sample_of_10
```

```{r}
# calculate the mean of the sample
sample_of_10 |>
  pull(ap_score) |> 
  mean()
```

# Calculate 1000 sample means

```{r}
sample_10_students = function(i) {
  # copy all the code from "Take a random sample of 10 students from a population that has a mean of 3.11" to here
}

sample_means = map_dbl(1:1000, sample_10_students)
ggplot(NULL) +
  aes(sample_means) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = .1)
```

# Calculate the p-value

```{r}
number_of_sample_means_above = sum(sample_means >= 3.8)
total_number_of_sample_means = length(sample_means)
pvalue = number_of_sample_means_above / total_number_of_sample_means
pvalue
```
